pullRequest.body:
This PR fixes some slow declarations, by
- changing the proof slightly so that unification is happier
- giving more arguments in a `rw` theorem
- replacing a slow `set` with `let`.
- explicitly supplying an autoparam proof, or adding the result to the context to help the autoparam.
- fixing a type so that a slow `erw` can become a less slow `rw`.
- replacing `‚ÄπRing R‚Ä∫` with `(‚ÄπRing R‚Ä∫:)`, which forces the expression to be fully elaborated immediately, instead of temporarily turning into a synthetic metavariable.
- reordering the instances in a spread construction of an instance (so that the ancestor that is represented as a subobject field comes first). See also #21030 for another example of this.

To find most of these, I took a look at the declarations that use at least 100000 heartbeats (i.e. at least half of the default maximum). 

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|1405|-1|erw|

Current commit [001cba334f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/001cba334f90e613e3dfb791fc91828c9f6070f0)
Reference commit [81a72b96bd](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/81a72b96bdfd703ae0ac6032fcfb159b823739b0)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/7ba57c63-b89e-438b-95e6-2fab7c6236fb) for commit ed5f85a73cac6721d40a56e4a367c1e13be01c7b.
There were [significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/9559e8c5-148d-4845-a637-807eba6dce4b/to/7ba57c63-b89e-438b-95e6-2fab7c6236fb) against commit 81a72b96bdfd703ae0ac6032fcfb159b823739b0:
```diff

+ ~Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Disintegration.Density                  instructions   -64.4%
+ ~Mathlib.RepresentationTheory.GroupCohomology.Resolution            instructions    -8.3%
+ ~Mathlib.RingTheory.DedekindDomain.Ideal                            instructions   -21.0%
+ ~Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Order                               instructions   -67.3%
```

This looks good to me.  I'll ping @mattrobball and @eric-wieser who have a better understanding of performance issues than I do.
Maybe a library note?  Or a wiki page?

I think this looks good to me. 

It would be useful to collect the underlying reasons as much as they are understood but I don't know where this would be done.

I think this looks good to me. 

It would be useful to collect the underlying reasons as much as they are understood but I don't know where this would be done.

```suggestion
  -- these two `have`s are just for performance
  have hb : 0 ‚â§ b := ha.trans hab
  have := IsSelfAdjoint.of_nonneg ha; have := IsSelfAdjoint.of_nonneg hb
```
maybe?
without this line, the have hb, the auto params don't all work anymore.
Sorry if this was unclear: I did not suggest to remove the lines, I simply moved the comment one line up and replaced the `rwo` with `two`.  The diff is hard to parse, though, I agree!
Yes, I fixed the typo, but I think the comment is in the correct line, as it only refers to `have := IsSelfAdjoint.of_nonneg ha; have := IsSelfAdjoint.of_nonneg hb`
If the comment isn't clear feel free to suggest a change

The comment is clear.  When I read the diff first, I had missed the two `have`s on the same line and thought that the comment referred to the "unique" `have` that I saw after your comment and the one above it.

```suggestion
      exact ContinuousLinearMap.continuous_det.continuousAt
```
does this work?
Yes

```suggestion
-- The following two lemmas also work without the `( :)`, but they are slow.
```
Just a typo.

pullRequest.title: perf: fix some slow declarations
